intro: Malope malacoides var. trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifid, meaning they are divided into three parts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
